alert.note: Alert for Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:32PM CDT until June 20 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR CLAY...SOUTHERN NORMAN...WESTERN BECKER...EASTERN CASS AND SOUTHEASTERN TRAILL COUNTIES... At 632 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Casselton, or 18 miles west of Fargo, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public report of semi blown over on I94 south of Buffalo North Dakota. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Mapleton around 640 PM CDT. Prosper and West Fargo around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Harwood, Brooktree Park, Reile`s Acres, North River, northern Fargo, Oakport, Kragnes and Georgetown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 52 and 93. Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 332 and 352. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 20. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
